com.java.controller.startup

Class StartUpPhase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.controller.startup.StartUpPhase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class StartUpPhase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    StartupPhase includes the logic to set up the game before it starts. it will arrange the players in a round robin fashion, based on the highest number generated by dice. Each country will be assigned randomly to the players in play. The initial army calculation is based on the number of players. provided a sort method to resolve ties between players in order to establish the round robin order.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Arnav Bhardwaj, Karan Dhingra, Ghalia Elkerdi, Sahil Singh Sodhi, Cristian Rodriguez
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • gameData

        public GameData gameData
        Game Data holds the whole data of the game, here the static variable holds the ids for the players. In that way it is possible to identify players even if the have the same name.
        See Also:
        GameData

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartUpPhase

        public StartUpPhase(GameData gameData)
        Default constructor receives game data as a parameter. Because this is the set up phase class every data is going to be calculated and set.
        Parameters:
        gameData - the game data object be set up.

    • Method Detail

      • generatePlayers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> generatePlayers(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerNames,
                                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> playerStrategy)
        It assigns unique ids to the players by receiving a collection of player names. the static variable is incremented by one every time a new player is created.
        Parameters:
        playerNames - list of names passed based on the console input from user
        playerStrategy - player strategy.
        Returns:
        A list that contains all the players which now have ids assigned.

      • generateCardsDeck

        public void generateCardsDeck()

      • assignCountriesToPlayers

        public void assignCountriesToPlayers()
        The approach to give the countries to the players is random. That means that each contry is randomly given to any player. But each player receives the same number of countries.

      • initialArmyCalculation

        public java.lang.Integer initialArmyCalculation(java.lang.Integer numPlayers)
        The initial army calculation is given by the number of players.
        Parameters:
        numPlayers - based on the number of players the method returns the initial army per player.
        Returns:
        the value that provides total initial army ammount per player

      • generateRoundRobin

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> generateRoundRobin()
        The order of play is given my the max result of the dices after every player roll a dice. If there is a tie the player roll again until one has a greter result.
        Returns:
        List of all players with proper order in which they will play for the rest of the game
